about.headline: About Me
about.description: Hi, I’m Kai Schulz, a Frontend Developer based in Pforzheim. Driven by my passion for IT and its endless possibilities, I focus on creating visually appealing and intuitive websites and applications.

content.paragraph1: I am flexible and work efficiently both on-site in Pforzheim and remotely. Always open to new challenges, I continuously seek opportunities to expand my knowledge and skills.
content.paragraph2: I am open-minded and always eager to take on new challenges to continuously enhance my knowledge and skills.
content.paragraph3: For me, programming is more than just writing code – it’s a creative way of solving problems. I enjoy transforming complex technical requirements into simple, user-friendly solutions, helping my clients achieve their goals and bring their visions to life.

skills.headline: Skills
skills.description: My journey has involved working on diverse projects, utilizing a wide range of frontend technologies and concepts. I am open to embracing new technologies and methodologies to continuously enhance my skills and stay ahead in the ever-evolving landscape of web development.
skills.paragraph: Feel free to contact me. I look forward to building on my existing knowledge and taking on new challenges.
skills.bubble: I have a special interest in learning

projects.headline: Featured Projects
projects.paragraph: Explore a selection of my work here – interact with the projects to see my skills in action.

join.name: Join
join.description: Join is a simple drag-and-drop Kanban board, built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, enabling you to manage contacts and tasks.

sharky.name: Kai the Shark
sharky.description: Kai the Shark is a 2D side-scroller browser game where you navigate a shark through dangerous waters and fight enemies with various attacks.

bubble.name: Pokedex
bubble.description: Pokedex is a website that retrieves and displays information about Pokémon and their attributes via the Poke API.

testimonials.headline: What My Colleagues Say About Me

t1.name: Mehmet Deliaci
t1.text: I worked with Kai on the Join project. With his reliable work ethic and creative ideas, he significantly contributed to the success of our project. I was especially impressed by his ability to solve complex tasks efficiently while keeping the team in focus.

t2.name: Denis Dudda
t2.text: Working with Kai has always been a pleasure! His energy, communication, and enthusiasm have constantly driven the project forward. I'm looking forward to more exciting collaborations in the future!

t3.name: David Lehnartz
t3.text: Working with Kai was always a rewarding experience. With his solution-oriented approach, he made a significant contribution to the success of our project, while motivating the team with creative ideas and a positive attitude.

contact.headline: Let’s Work Together!
contact.solve: Is there a problem I can solve?
contact.paragraph: Contact me through this form – I’m excited to hear from you, learn about your ideas, and contribute to your projects with my work.

email.label: Email
email.error: Please enter a valid Email address!

placeholder.part1: You agree that I may use the specified data to process your request. You can find additional information on data protection and the right of withdrawal in my

s1.hl: INFORMATION ON THE COLLECTION OF PERSONAL DATA
s1.p1: (1) Below we inform you about the collection of personal data when using our website. Personal data includes all data that can be related to you personally, e.g., name, address, email addresses, user behavior. Through this, we aim to inform you about our processing activities and fulfill our legal obligations, particularly under the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
s1.p2: (2) The data controller according to Art. 4 para. 7 EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is Altenweg 47, 75228 Ispringen,
s1.p3: (3) When you contact us via email or a contact form, the data you provide (your email address, and if applicable, your name and phone number) is stored by us to answer your inquiries. Any data arising in this context will be deleted once it is no longer required for the purpose of the inquiry unless it pertains to a contract and must be retained for the duration of the contract. Otherwise, the data will be deleted or its processing restricted if legal retention periods apply.
s1.p4: (4) If we rely on commissioned service providers for individual functionalities of our offerings or if we wish to use your data for promotional purposes, we will carefully select and monitor these service providers and inform you below in detail about the respective processes. We will also specify the set criteria for the storage duration.

s2.p1: (1) You have the following rights regarding your personal data:
s2.p2: (2) You also have the right to file a complaint with a data protection supervisory authority about the processing of your personal data by us.

s3.hl: COLLECTION OF PERSONAL DATA WHEN VISITING OUR WEBSITE
s3.p1: COLLECTION OF PERSONAL DATA WHEN VISITING OUR WEBSITE

li.l2: Date and time of the request
li.l3: Time zone difference to Greenwich Mean Time (GMT)
li.l7: Website from which the request comes
li.l10: Language and version of the browser software

p2.1: (2) In addition to the aforementioned data, cookies may be stored on your computer during your use of our website. Cookies are small text files stored on your hard drive, associated with the browser you use, and through which certain information flows to the entity setting the cookie (in this case, us). Cookies cannot execute programs or transfer viruses to your computer. They serve to make the internet offering more user-friendly and effective overall (legal basis is Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. a GDPR). You can delete or block cookies at any time through the settings in your browser.
p2.2: Furthermore, we may use technologies such as local storage or session storage in the future. Local storage allows data to be stored in the cache of your browser, remaining even after the browser is closed unless actively deleted. Local storage enables your preferences to be saved locally and reused on your computer. Session storage works similarly but is deleted immediately after closing the browser ('session'). These technologies ensure that third parties cannot access or use this data. They are primarily employed to provide you with an appealing graphical presentation of our content and personalize our offerings and navigation for you. You can manage local storage settings via the 'History' or 'Local Data' settings in your browser.

s3.p3: (3) We primarily use the techniques described above to enhance user-friendliness and the functionality of our websites. The lawful basis for this is our legitimate interest in providing you with a functional and attractive offer, as per Article 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR. If additional consent for the use of cookies is required, we will explicitly ask for your consent in the relevant context. In cases where cookies are used based on your consent, the legal basis is Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. a GDPR. If you do not wish to allow the use of the described technologies, you can configure your browser settings accordingly.

a.text: a) This website may use the following types of cookies, whose scope and functionality are explained below:

p4.b: b) Transient cookies are automatically deleted when you close the browser. These include session cookies that store a session ID, allowing different requests from your browser to be assigned to the same session. This enables your computer to be recognized when you return to our website. Session cookies are deleted when you log out or close the browser.
p4.c: c) Persistent cookies are automatically deleted after a specified period, which can vary depending on the cookie. You can delete cookies at any time in the security settings of your browser.
p4.d: d) You can configure your browser settings to reject third-party cookies or all cookies. Please note that this may limit the functionality of this website.

s4.hl: OTHER FUNCTIONS AND SERVICES ON OUR WEBSITE
s4.p1: (1) In addition to the purely informational use of our website, we may offer various services that you can use if interested. Generally, you must provide additional personal data for these services, which we use to provide the respective service and for which the principles of data processing mentioned above apply.
s4.p2: (2) We sometimes use external service providers to process your data. These providers are carefully selected and commissioned, are bound by our instructions, and are regularly monitored.
s4.p3: (3) Furthermore, we may share your personal data with third parties when participating in promotions, sweepstakes, contract conclusions, or similar services in cooperation with partners. Detailed information will be provided when your personal data is collected or in the description of the offering below.
s4.p4: (4) If our service providers or partners are located in a country outside the European Economic Area (EEA), we will inform you about the consequences of this circumstance in the description of the offering.

s5.hl: OBJECTION OR WITHDRAWAL OF YOUR DATA PROCESSING
s5.p1: (1) If you have given consent to the processing of your data, you can withdraw it at any time. Such withdrawal will affect the lawfulness of the processing of your personal data after you have notified us of it.
s5.p2: (2) If we base the processing of your personal data on a legitimate interest, you may object to the processing. This applies particularly if the processing is not necessary for fulfilling a contract with you, as we explain in the following descriptions of the functions. When exercising such an objection, please explain the reasons why we should not process your personal data as we do. In case of a justified objection, we will review the matter and either stop or adjust the data processing or demonstrate to you our compelling legitimate grounds for continuing the processing.
s5.p3: (3) Of course, you can object to the processing of your personal data for advertising and data analysis purposes at any time. You can notify us of your objection to advertising using the following contact details: Altenweg 47, 75228 Ispringen,

s6.p: We store personal data in accordance with the statutory retention periods (e.g., under commercial and tax law). After these periods expire, the data will be deleted unless it is still required for contract fulfillment or there is a legitimate interest in its further storage.

disclaimer.headline: LIABILITY
disclaimer.p1: We are responsible for the contents of our internet pages in accordance with the general laws, particularly § 7 para. 1 of the Telemedia Act. All content is created with the utmost care and to the best of our knowledge. As far as we refer to third-party websites via hyperlinks on our internet pages, we cannot guarantee the continuous currentness, accuracy, and completeness of the linked content, as these contents are outside our area of responsibility and we have no influence on their future design. If you consider any content to violate applicable law or be inappropriate, please inform us.
disclaimer.p2: The legal notices on this page as well as all questions and disputes related to the design of this website are subject to the law of the Federal Republic of Germany.

data.p1: You can find our data protection information at

owner.p: The texts, images, photos, videos, or graphics on our website are generally protected by copyright. Any unauthorized use (especially reproduction, editing, or distribution) of these copyrighted contents is therefore prohibited. If you intend to use these contents or parts thereof, please contact us in advance using the above details. If we are not the holders of the required copyright usage rights, we will endeavor to establish contact with the rights holder.
